title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 35.2 - Filing of application
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 35.2 - Filing of application

State Regulations
(a) An
application for a permit must be filed with the authority no less than 45 days
prior to the date for which the permit is sought. (b) Notice of the applicant's intent to apply
for the permit must be sent to the police department of the municipality in
which the licensed premises is located. If such municipality has no police
department, notice must be sent to the county sheriff's department. (1)

The applicant must submit proof of
mailing of such notice with the application; (2)
acceptable proof of mailing shall consist
of either: (i) copy of the notice sent to the
police department and the original or a copy of the certified mail receipt
card; or
(ii)
the original or a
copy of the notice date stamped and signed by the police department. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
35.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
